sources.full: Eldritch Arcana - Tasha's Cauldron of Everything

default: (a) a {@item light crossbow|phb} and {@item crossbow bolts (20)|phb|20 bolts} or (b) any {@filter simple weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon}
(a) a {@item component pouch|phb} or (b) an {@item arcane focus|phb}
(a) a {@item scholar's pack|phb} or (b) a {@item dungeoneer's pack|phb}
Any {@filter simple weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon}, {@item leather armor|phb}, and two {@item dagger|phb|daggers}

classFeature.name: Otherworldly Patron
entries: At 1st level, you have struck a bargain with an otherworldly being of your choice: the Ancient Phoenix, the {@class warlock|phb|Archfey|archfey}, the Celestial, the Chosen of Mystra, the {@class warlock|phb|Fiend|fiend}, the {@class warlock|phb|Great Old One|great old one}, the Shadowforce, or the {@class warlock|phb|Undying|undying}. Your choice grants you features at 1st level and again at 6th level, 10th level, and 14th level.

classFeature.name: Pact Magic
entries: Your arcane research and the magic bestowed on you by your patron have given you facility with spells. See the {@i Player's Handbook} for the general rules of {@book spellcasting|PHB|10} and for the {@filter warlock spell list|spells|class=warlock (EldArc)}.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You know two cantrips of your choice from the warlock spell list. The Warlock table above shows when you learn additional warlock cantrips of your choice.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Warlock table shows how many spell slots you have. The table also shows what the level of those slots is; your spell slots are all the same level. To cast one of your warlock spells of 1st level or higher, you must expend a spell slot. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a short or long rest.
For example, when you are 5th level, you have two 3rd-level spell slots. To cast the 1st-level spell {@spell witch bolt}, you must spend one of those slots, and you cast it as a 3rd-level spell.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st Level and Higher
entries: At 1st level, you know two 1st-level spells of your choice from the warlock spell list.

The Spells Known column of the Warlock table shows when you learn more warlock spells of your choice of 1st level and higher. A spell you choose must be of a level no higher than what's shown in the table's Slot Level column for your level. When you reach 6th level, for example, you learn a new warlock spell of 3rd level or lower.

Also, when you gain a level in this class, you can replace one warlock spell you know with another spell from the warlock spell list. The new spell must also be of a level for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Choose either Intelligence or Charisma when you gain this feature. Your choice determines your spellcasting ability for your warlock spells. You use the chosen ability score when setting the saving throw DC and when making attack rolls with warlock spells you cast.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use an {@item arcane focus|phb} as a spellcasting focus for your warlock spells.

classFeature.name: Eldritch Invocations
entries: At 2nd level,through your study of occult lore, you have unearthed eldritch invocations, fragments of forbidden knowledge that imbue you with an abiding magical ability. You gain one eldritch invocation of your choice from the options listed {@filter here|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=EI|Source=EldArc}. At certain warlock levels, you gain new invocations of your choice, as shown in the Invocations Known column of the Warlock table.
When you gain a level in this class, you can replace one invocation you know with another available invocation for your warlock level.

classFeature.name: Pact Boon
entries: Also at 2nd level, your patron bestows a gift upon you for your loyal service.You gain one of the following features of your choice.

entries.name: Pact of the Armory
entries: You can use your action to create a magical pact weapon in your empty hand. You choose the form that this weapon takes each time you create it; it can take the form of any {@filter melee weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=melee weapon}, a {@item shortbow|phb}, a {@item longbow|phb}, a {@item light crossbow|phb} or a {@item heavy crossbow|phb}. You are proficient with your pact weapon while you wield it, and you can use your spellcasting ability modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity, for your attack and damage rolls with it.
Your pact weapon disappears if it is more than 5 feet away from you for 1 minute or more, if you use this action again, if you dismiss the weapon (no action required),or if you die.

You can transform one magic weapon into your pact weapon by performing a 1-hour-long special ritual while you hold the weapon. The ritual counts as light activity while you are resting. You gain the ability to dismiss the weapon (no action required), shunting it into an extradimensional space. You can cause it to reappear whenever you create your pact weapon thereafter. The weapon ceases being your pact weapon if you die, if you perform the ritual on another weapon, or if you perform a 1-hour ritual to break your bond to it. The weapon appears at your feet if it's shunted away when the bond breaks.

Also, you can use your action to touch a suit of light or medium armor, which can include a shield, that isn't being worn or carried. Until you use this feature again on another set of equipment, while you wear this equipment, it is magical, and you are proficient with it.

entries.name: Pact of the Chain
entries: You learn the find familiar spell and can cast it as a ritual. The spell doesn't count against your number of spells known. You gain the following choices for your familiar's form: {@creature imp}, {@creature phoenix wisp|EldArc}, {@creature pseudodragon}, {@creature quasit}, or {@creature sprite|EldArc}. You can communicate telepathically with your familiar and perceive through your familiar's senses while you are on the same plane of existence. While perceiving through your familiar's senses, you can speak through your familiar in your own voice, even if your familiar is normally incapable of speech.

Also, you can use your action or you can forego one of your attacks when you take an action that allows you to make one or more attacks—like the Attack or Cast a Spell action—to allow your familiar to make one attack using its reaction.

entries.name: Pact of the Effigy
entries: You have a mysterious effigy with a surface that constantly shifts like water. With the effigy in hand, you can use your action and choose a creature you can see within 60 feet of you to magically steal a sliver of their essence, cursing them and storing the essence in your effigy.This essence imposes disadvantage on the creature's Wisdom (Insight) checks against you, as well as its saving throws against being charmed by you. Casting {@spell remove curse} on the cursed creature or on the effigy removes the curse and makes the creature immune to this effect for 24 hours.

You can have a number of essences equal to your proficiency bonus stored within the effigy at a time. When you steal a creature's essence, you can choose to replace one of your current essences with the new one.

entries.name: Pact of the Gauntlet
entries: Your arms become covered in a thin layer of eerie, unearthly metal that channels powerful arcane blasts. You learn the {@spell eldritch blast} cantrip; if you already know it, you instead learn one warlock cantrip of your choice.Once per turn when you cast eldritch blast, you can split part of the beam, targeting a different creature within range and making a separate attack roll. This beam deals {@damage 1d4} force damage on a hit.

With these gauntlets, you can use your spellcasting ability modifier in place of Strength for ability checks and saving throws. You can also choose to use your spellcasting ability modifier for the attack and damage rolls of your unarmed strikes.

entries.name: Pact of the Symbol
entries: You receive a symbol imbued with the influence of your patron's power. You can use your bonus action to create this pact symbol in one of your free hands, which takes the shape of any {@item arcane focus|phb}, {@item druidic focus|phb}, {@item musical instrument|phb|instrument}, or {@item holy symbol|phb} of your choice. If you choose an instrument, you are proficient with it while you wield it. You can use this symbol as a spellcasting focus for your warlock spells. Using this feature again destroys your current pact symbol.

Your pact symbol contains one influence charge, used to call upon your patron's power over your fate. While you hold the symbol, before making a d20 roll for one of your warlock spells, you can expend the charge to replace the d20 roll with a 10. Whenever you finish a short or long rest, or whenever you roll a 1 or a 20 on the d20 for a spell attack, the symbol regains its influence charge if it has been expended.

entries.name: Pact of the Tome
entries: Your patron gives you a grimoire called a Book of Shadows. When you gain this feature, choose three cantrips from any class's spell list (the three needn't be from the same list). While the book is on your person, you can cast those cantrips at will. They don't count against your number of cantrips known. If they don't appear on the warlock spell list,they are nonetheless warlock spells for you.

If you lose your Book of Shadows, you can perform a 1-hour ceremony to receive a replacement from your patron. This ceremony can be performed during a short or long rest, and it destroys the previous book.The book turns to ash when you die.

classFeature.name: Agonizing Cantrip
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can add your spellcasting ability modifier to damage rolls you make with any warlock cantrip, except for damage rolls that already add your spellcasting ability modifier.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Liminal Loop
entries: At 5th level, when you cast a warlock cantrip, instead of increasing that damage when you reach certain levels, you can cast the cantrip additional times as part of the same action. The cantrip must deal damage, and it must make a spell attack or require a saving throw. You can cast it two times at 5th level, three times at 11th level,and four times at17th level. When you do, the cantrip can deal its damage more than once, but its other effects aren't applied to the same target again.

classFeature.name: Otherworldly Patron feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain an additional feature from your Otherworldy Patron.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Otherworldly Patron feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain an additional feature from your Otherworldy Patron.

classFeature.name: Mystic Arcanum (6th Level)
entries: At 11th level, choose a 6th-level spell from the warlock spell list as an arcanum. You can cast your arcanum spell once without expending a spell slot. You must finish a long rest before you can do so again.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Mystic Arcanum (7th Level)
entries: At 13th level, choose a 7th-level spell from the warlock spell list as an additional arcanum. You can cast your additional arcanum spell once without expending a spell slot. You must finish a long rest before you can do so again.

classFeature.name: Otherworldly Patron feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain an additional feature from your Otherworldy Patron.

classFeature.name: Mystic Arcanum (8th Level)
entries: At 15th level, choose a 8th-level spell from the warlock spell list as an additional arcanum. You can cast your additional arcanum spell once without expending a spell slot. You must finish a long rest before you can do so again.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Mystic Arcanum (9th Level)
entries: At 17th level, choose a 9th-level spell from the warlock spell list as an additional arcanum. You can cast your additional arcanum spell once without expending a spell slot. You must finish a long rest before you can do so again.

classFeature.name: Vault of Knowledge
entries: At 18th level, you learn the secret to tapping the depths your patron's otherworldly knowledge and power. You can replace one of your invocations with another option when you finish a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Arcane Feedback
entries: At 20th level, whenever you use your Mystic Arcanum feature, you can regain one expended spell slot from your Pact Magic feature.

optionalfeature.name: Aberrant Implantation
entries: You can cast {@spell awaken} once without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Accursed Weapon
entries: When you hit with your pact weapon, you can deal extra necrotic damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum of 1).

optionalfeature.name: Ancient Insight
entries: You can cast {@spell legend lore} once without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Enigma
entries: You can cast {@spell nystul's magic aura} at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.

optionalfeature.name: Armor of Shadows
entries: You can cast {@spell mage armor} on yourself at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.

optionalfeature.name: Ascendant Step
entries: You can cast {@spell levitate} on yourself at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.

optionalfeature.name: Aspect of the Moon
entries: You no longer need sleep and can't be forced to sleep. You can gain the benefits of a long rest by spending 8 hours doing only light activity.

optionalfeature.name: Beast Song
entries: You can cast {@spell speak with animals} at will, without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Beguiling Influence
entries: You gain proficiency in the Deception and Persuasion skills. If you're already proficient in either skill, your proficiency bonus is doubled for any check you make with that skill.

optionalfeature.name: Bewitching Whispers
entries: You can cast {@spell compulsion} once without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Bolstered Familiar
entries: When you summon a familiar using your Pact of the Chain feature,it gains the following benefits:

items: One of the familiar's ability scores of your choice increases by 2, to a maximum of 20.
The familiar's maximum hit points increase by an amount equal to twice your warlock level.
The familiar adds a bonus to its AC, to its saving throws, to ability checks using skills with which it is proficient, and to its attack rolls. The bonus equals your proficiency bonus minus 2.
The familiar can use your warlock spell DC for its features.

optionalfeature.name: Book of Ancient Secrets
entries: You can now inscribe rituals in your Book of Shadows. Choose two 1st-level spells that have the ritual tag from any class's spell list (the two needn't be from the same list). The spells appear in the book and don't count against the number of spells you know. With your Book of Shadows in hand, you can cast the chosen spells. You can only cast the spells as rituals, unless you've learned them by some other means. You can also cast your warlock spells that have the ritual tag as rituals.

On your adventures, you can add other ritual spells to your Book of Shadows. When you find such a spell, you can add it to the book if the spell's level is equal to or less than half your warlock level (rounded up) and if you can spare the time to transcribe the spell. For each level of the spell, the transcription process takes 2 hours and costs 50 gp for the rare inks needed to inscribe it.

optionalfeature.name: Breath of the Night
entries: You know the {@spell bestow curse} spell, which counts as a warlock spell for you. When you target a creature that is already cursed by your pact effigy with {@spell bestow curse}, the spell's level increases by one for each curse you've placed on the target (including this casting of {@spell bestow curse}), you don't need to concentrate on the spell if the spell's level is 5th or higher when you cast it, and the spell ends early if the target isn't cursed by you through any other means.

optionalfeature.name: Call of the Lost
entries: You can cast {@spell phantasmal force} once without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Chain Master's Fury
entries: Your familiar can now attack in combat, using its normal action options (except its Multiattack, if the familiar has one). Also, when your familiar hits with an attack, you can use your reaction to cast the {@spell hex} spell on the target of your familiar's attack.

optionalfeature.name: Chains of Carceri
entries: You can cast {@spell hold monster} at will — targeting a celestial, fiend, or elemental — without expending a spell slot or material components. You must finish a long rest before you can use this invocation on the same creature again.

optionalfeature.name: Cloak of Flies
entries: As a bonus action, you can surround yourself with a magical aura that looks like buzzing flies. The aura extends 5 feet from you in every direction, but not through total cover. It lasts until you're incapacitated or you dismiss it as a bonus action.

The aura grants you advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks but disadvantage on all other Charisma checks. Any other creature that starts its turn in the aura takes poison damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum of 0 damage).
Once you use this invocation, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Devil's Sight
entries: You can see normally in darkness, both magical and non-magical, to a distance of 120 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Dreadful Word
entries: You can cast {@spell confusion} once without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Emblazoned Chain
entries: Your familiar can trigger the effects of curses you've placed on creatures, and it adds your spellcasting ability modifier to its damage rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Ejection of Spirit
entries: While your effigy has a creature's essence in it, you can use your reaction when you are attacked to eject the essence, attempting to absorb the blow. Roll a d20; on an 11 or above,the essence absorbs the attack instead of you; you take no damage from the attack, and both your attacker and the creature that the essence belongs to takes necrotic damage equal to your warlock level, plus {@damage 1d6} for each curse you've placed upon them. Regardless of your roll on the d20,the essence is then destroyed.

foundrySystem.activation.condition: you are attacked while your effigy has a creature's essence in it

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Cone
entries: As an action, you create a cone of crackling energy in a 15-foot cone originating from you.Creatures in the area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take force damage equal to {@damage 4d8} plus your spellcasting ability modifier. You can expend a spell slot to increase the damage by {@damage 1d8} and the size of the cone by 5 feet for each level of the slot.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Doom
entries: As an action, choose a point that you can see within 120 feet of you. An explosion of crackling energy erupts from that point, filling a 5-foot radius around it. Creatures in the area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take force damage equal to {@damage 6d6} plus your spellcasting ability modifier. You can expend a spell slot to increase the damage by {@damage 1d6} and the radius by 5 feet for each level of the slot.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Sight
entries: You can cast {@spell detect magic} at will, without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Spear
entries: When you cast {@spell eldritch blast}, its range is doubled.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Wave
entries: As an action, you create a beam of crackling energy that's 5-feet-wide by 20-feet-long. Creatures in the area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take force damage equal to {@damage 2d10} plus your spellcasting ability modifier. You can expend a spell slot to increase the damage by {@damage 1d10} and the length of the beam by 10 feet for each level of the slot.

optionalfeature.name: Eyes of the Rune Keeper
entries: You automatically understand the meaning of any non-magical writing that you read, and you can see writing that is invisible.

optionalfeature.name: Fate's Vice
entries: When you deal damage with a curse, you can deal psychic damage instead of the curse's damage type. Also, at the top of each hour, you can deal psychic damage to any number of creatures that are cursed by you, as long as you are on the same plane of existence. You choose the amount of damage each target takes, but you can't deal more damage to a single creature than half of your warlock level times the number of curses you've placed on that creature.

optionalfeature.name: Fiendish Vigor
entries: You can cast {@spell false life} on yourself at will at its lowest level, without expending a spell slot or material components.

optionalfeature.name: Gaze of Two Minds
entries: You can use your action to touch a willing humanoid and perceive through its senses until the end of your next turn. As long as the creature is on the same plane of existence as you, you can use your action on subsequent turns to extend the duration until the end of your next turn. While perceiving through the target creature's senses, you benefit from any of that creature's special senses, and you are blinded and deafened to your own surroundings.

optionalfeature.name: Ghostly Gaze
entries: As an action, you gain the ability to see through solid objects to a range of 30 feet for 1 minute or until your concentration ends (as if you were concentrating on a spell). Within that range, you have darkvision if you don't already have it. During that time, you perceive objects as ghostly, transparent images. You can't use this invocation again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of the Depths
entries: You can breathe underwater, and you gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.
You can also cast {@spell water breathing} once without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of the Ever-Living Ones
entries: Whenever you regain hit points while your familiar is within 100 feet of you, treat any dice rolled to determine the hit points you regain as having rolled their maximum value for you.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of the Protectors
entries: A page appears in your Book of Shadows which contains a number of names equal to your spellcasting ability modifier. If you allow, a creature can use its action to write its name on the page. Any creature whose name is on the page is under the effects of the {@spell death ward} spell. When the spell ends for a creature, the creature's name disappears from the page. Each creature's name can't be inscribed onto the page again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Grasp of Hadar
entries: When you hit a creature with your {@spell eldritch blast}, you can move the target in a straight line 10 feet closer to you.

optionalfeature.name: Heed the Call
entries: When you cast a warlock spell, instead of the spell originating from you, you can cause the spell to originate from your pact symbol, as long as you are on the same plane of existence. Also, a creature holding your pact symbol can use its action to teleport, switching places with you and leaving the symbol behind, as long as you are within 500 feet of each other. Once this action has been used, it can't be used again by any creature until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Hidden in Oblivion
entries: You can cast {@spell nondetection} at will, targeting yourself, without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Hideous Blow
entries: When you cast {@spell eldritch blast}, you can replace any number of the beams with an equal number of melee spell attacks that deal force damage equal to the damage dealt by the beam on a hit. You can add a +1 bonus to the attack and damage rolls of each melee spell attack you make in this way.

optionalfeature.name: Horrific Shackles
entries: You can cast {@spell phantasmal killer} once without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Pact Weapon
entries: You can use any weapon you summon with your Pact of the Armory feature as a spellcasting focus for your warlock spells.

Additionally, once per turn when you hit a creature with your pact weapon, you can expend a warlock spell slot to deal an extra {@damage 1d8} force damage, plus another 1d8 per level of the spell slot, and you can knock the target {@condition prone} if it is Huge or smaller.

optionalfeature.name: Lance of Lethargy
entries: Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with your {@spell eldritch blast}, you can reduce that creature's speed by 10 feet until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Lifedrinker
entries: Once on each of your turns,when you hit a creature with a weapon attack using your pact weapon, you can regain hit points equal to half the damage dealt (minimum of 0).

optionalfeature.name: Maddening Hex
entries: Once on each of your turns,when you hit a creature with a weapon attack using your pact weapon, you can regain hit points equal to half the damage dealt (minimum of 0).

optionalfeature.name: Mask of Many Faces
entries: You can cast {@spell disguise self} at will, without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Master's Imposition
entries: While your pact symbol is on your person, you have advantage on ability checks and saving throws against spells (including those that you cast), and the DC of ability checks other creatures make against your warlock spells increases by half your warlock level.

optionalfeature.name: Mask of Many Faces
entries: You can cast {@spell alter self} at will, without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Materializing Focus
entries: When you cast a warlock spell using your patron's symbol as a spellcasting focus, you can forego providing a material component if its value is no more than 25gp times your warlock level. If the spell's material component costs more than this amount, you can decrease the required cost of the component by the same amount.

optionalfeature.name: Minions of Chaos
entries: You can cast {@spell conjure elemental} once without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Mire the Mind
entries: You can cast {@spell slow} once without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Nightmares from Beyond
entries: You can cast {@spell animate dead} using a warlock spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast the spell once without expending a spell slot, and you must finish a long rest before you can do so again.

optionalfeature.name: One with Shadows
entries: When you are in dim light or darkness, you can use your action to become {@condition invisible} until you move, take an action, or take a reaction.

optionalfeature.name: Otherworldly Leap
entries: Your jump distance is tripled, and you do not need a running start to attain the full distance of your long jumps.

optionalfeature.name: Otherworldly Whispers
entries: You gain proficiency in the Arcana and Religion skills. If you're already proficient in either skill, your proficiency bonus is doubled for any check you make with that skill.

optionalfeature.name: Pact-forged Counsel
entries: You can cast {@spell planar ally} once without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Prophetic Falsehoods
entries: You can cast the {@spell guidance} cantrip. If you target a creature other than yourself, rather than adding the result of its d4 roll to an ability check, the DM subtracts the result in secret.

optionalfeature.name: Relentless Hex
entries: As a bonus action, you can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see within 5 feet of the target cursed by your {@spell hex} spell or by a warlock feature of yours, such as Sign of Ill Omen. To teleport in this way, you must be able to see the cursed target.

optionalfeature.name: Scribe of Esoteric Knowledge
entries: Instead of knowing spells, you prepare a number of spells equal to the Spells Known column of the warlock table plus your spellcasting ability modifier from the warlock spell list. Spells you choose must be of a level no greater than what's shown in the Warlock table's Slot Level column for your level. You can replace any of your prepared spells whenever you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Sculptor of Flesh
entries: You can cast {@spell polymorph} once without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Shepherd of the Occult
entries: You can cast {@spell scrying} at will - targeting a creature cursed by you - without expending a spell slot or providing material components. Your curse counts as a body part for the purposes of determining the save DC for the spell. For the duration of a {@spell scrying} spell you've cast in this way, the target of your scrying is also a valid target for your other warlock spells - regardless of the distance between you and the target - provided you can see the target through the sensor, and the spell that you cast can only target a single creature.

optionalfeature.name: Shroud of Shadow
entries: You can cast {@spell invisibility} at will,without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Sign of Ill Omen
entries: You can cast {@spell bestow curse} once without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Sovereign Arcana
entries: Whenever you finish a long rest, you may choose new spells from the warlock spell list to replace any of your Mystic Arcanum choices. Each new spell must be of the same spell level as the one it replaces.

optionalfeature.name: Symbolic Bond
entries: While another creature is carrying your pact symbol, that creature can cast any warlock spells that you know, as long as you allow it. A spell cast in this way originates from the creature carrying your symbol, and you must pay any associated cost, but is otherwise treated as though you had cast the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Thief of Five Fates
entries: You can cast {@spell bane} once without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Thirsting Blade
entries: Whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can make one additional attack with your pact weapon as part of the action.

optionalfeature.name: Tomb of Levistus
entries: As a reaction when you take damage, you can entomb yourself in ice, which melts away at the end of your next turn. You gain 10 temporary hit points per warlock level, which take as much of the triggering damage as possible. Immediately after you take the damage, you gain vulnerability to fire damage, your speed is reduced to 0, and you are {@condition incapacitated}. These effects, including any remaining temporary hit points, all end when the ice melts.
Once you use this invocation, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Toy of Whimsy's Calling
entries: You can cast {@spell tiny servant|XGE} once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Trickster's Escape
entries: You can cast {@spell freedom of movement} once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Two Wise Monkeys
entries: You can cast {@spell blindness/deafness} once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Usurper in Shadow
entries: You can cast {@spell find familiar} as an action, instead of its normal casting time, and you can have a maximum of two familiars from this spell. In addition, you can choose from one of the following forms when you cast {@spell find familiar}, in addition to any forms you already have: {@creature gargoyle}, {@creature nothic}, and {@creature will-o'-wisp}.

optionalfeature.name: Visions of Distant Realms
entries: You can cast {@spell arcane eye} at will, without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Warmonger's Calling
entries: When you touch a suit of armor and grant it the benefits of your Pact of the Armory feature, that armor can be heavy armor, and you can teleport it onto you, instantly donning it as part of the action.

optionalfeature.name: Weaver of Nightmares
entries: You can cast {@spell web} once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Whispers of the Grave
entries: You can cast {@spell speak with dead} at will, without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Witch Sight
entries: You can see the true form of any shapechanger or creature concealed by illusion or transmutation magic while the creature is within 30 feet of you and within line of sight.

spell.name: Eldritch Blast

entries: When using {@class warlock|EldArc|this class}, it is recommended to make the following change to the eldritch blast cantrip. This change requires that you take 5 levels in {@class Warlock|EldArc} to get their signature "multi-cast" cantrip style as a balancing measure for multiclassing.
A beam of crackling energy streaks toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d10} force damage.
This spell's damage increases by {@damage 1d10} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d10}),11th level ({@damage 3d10}),and 17th level ({@damage 4d10}).

monster.name: Phoenix Wisp
languages: understands Common and Primordial, but can't speak

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The phoenix wisp's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}, +4 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Keen Senses
entries: The phoenix wisp has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight, hearing, or smell.

trait.name: Limited Telepathy
entries: The phoenix wisp can magically communicate simple ideas, emotions, and images telepathically with any creature within 100 ft. of it that can understand a language.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The phoenix wisp has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Peck
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing and 2 ({@damage 1d4}) fire or radiant damage.

action.name: Flame Lick
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 4} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) fire or radiant damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The sprite's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 11}, +3 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The sprite's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Read Intent
entries: The sprite knows the emotional state of any creature it can see. It also knows whether the creature is hostile, neutral, or friendly to the sprite.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. If the poisoned target failed its saving throw by 5 or more, it falls {@condition unconscious} for the same duration, or until it takes damage or another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 40/160 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Heart Sight
entries: The sprite touches a creature, and the target must make a {@dc 10} Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the sprite knows the creature's alignment. Celestials, fiends, and undead automatically fail the saving throw.

action.name: Invisibility
entries: The sprite magically turns {@condition invisible} until it attacks or casts a spell, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the sprite wears or carries is invisible with it.

subclass.name: The Great Old One
subclassFeatures: The Great Old One|Warlock|PHB|Great Old One|PHB|1

subclassFeature.name: The Celestial
entries: Your patron is a powerful being of the Upper Planes. You have bound yourself to an ancient {@creature empyrean}, {@creature solar}, {@creature ki-rin|VGM}, {@creature unicorn}, or other entity that resides in the planes of everlasting bliss. Your pact with that being allows you to experience the barest touch of the holy light that illuminates the multiverse.

Being connected to such power can cause changes in your behavior and beliefs. You might find yourself driven to annihilate the undead, to defeat fiends, and to protect the innocent. At times, your heart might also be filled with a longing for the celestial realm of your patron, and a desire to wander that paradise for the rest of your days. But you know that your mission is among mortals for now, and that your pact binds you to bring light to the dark places of the world.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Celestial lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

entries.caption: Celestial Expanded Spells
rows: {@spell guardian of faith}, {@spell wall of fire}

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Cantrips
entries: When you choose this patron at 1st level, you learn the {@spell light} and {@spell sacred flame} cantrips. They count as warlock cantrips for you, but they don't count against your number of cantrips known.

subclassFeature.name: Healing Light
entries: At lst level, you gain the ability to channel celestial energy to heal wounds. You have a pool of d8s that you spend to fuel this healing. The number of dice in the pool equals 1 + half of your warlock level, rounded down (minimum of 0). Your pool regains all expended dice when you finish a long rest.

As a bonus action, you can spend dice from the pool to heal one creature you can see within 60 feet of you. The maximum number of dice you can spend at once equals your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum of one die). Roll the dice you spend, add them together,and restore a number of hit points equal to the total.

subclassFeature.name: Radiant Soul
entries: Starting at 6th level, your link to the Celestial emblazons your soul with radiant energy, protecting you. You have resistance to radiant damage, and you are immune to poison and disease.

subclassFeature.name: Celestial Reinforcement
entries: Starting at 10th level, the Celestial magic you wield circulates through you, reinforcing your healing abilities.

When the result of a Healing Light die you roll is below your proficiency bonus, you can replace the result with your proficiency bonus. Also, you and up to 5 creatures of your choice that can see you gain temporary hit points equal to your warlock level + your spellcasting ability modifier whenever you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Ascendant Aura
entries: Starting at 14th level,the radiant energy you channel exudes from your body, healing your allies and burning your foes.

At the start of each of your turns, you can roll a die from your pool of Healing light. Each creature of your choice within a 30-foot radius of you regains hit points equal to the amount rolled + half of your warlock level, and each other creature within the area must make a Constitution saving throw, taking radiant damage equal to the amount rolled + half your warlock level on a failed saving throw, or half as much damage on a successful one.

subclassFeature.name: The Shadowforce
entries: You have made your pact with a mysterious entity — a force manifested in sentient magic weapons carved from shadowstuff. The force behind these weapons can offer power to warlocks who form pacts with it. These warlocks - sometimes called hexblades - can weave this powerful dark magic into the world.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Shadowforce lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

entries.caption: Shadowforce Expanded Spells
rows: {@spell Mordenkainen's faithful hound|PHB|faithful hound}, {@spell phantasmal killer}

subclassFeature.name: Hexblade's Curse
entries: Also at 1st level, you can imbue your weapons with a curse that seals victims' abilities.

While you wield a weapon or arcane focus, you can emblazon it with intricate runes that form a wicked, sealing curse - the Hexblade's Curse. While you wield this emblazoned item, you can force a creature you hit with a weapon or spell attack to succeed on a Charisma saving throw against your spell save DC or be cursed with the Hexblade's Curse for 1 minute. A creature can only be forced to make this saving throw once per turn.
As powerful hexes hamper its abilities, the creature cursed by your Hexblade's Curse must roll a d4 and subtract it from any ability checks,attack rolls,or saving throws it makes.
Once you've cursed a creature with this feature, you can't use this feature again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Shadow Shroud
entries: At 6th level, you weave shadowy magic around your body, protecting you from attacks.

When you are hit with an attack, you can use your reaction to activate your protective shroud, which lasts until the start of your next turn. If you do, roll a d6 whenever an attack hits you, including during the triggering attack; on a 4 or higher, the attack instead misses you.
Once you have used this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

foundrySystem.activation.condition: you are hit with an attack

subclassFeature.name: Accursed Specter
entries: Starting at 10th level, you can bind the souls of the slain to your service, weaving them into a shadowy form.

When you slay a creature, you can cause its spirit to rise from its corpse as a {@creature specter}, the statistics for which are in the Monster Manual. When the specter appears, it takes the form of a shadowy, panther-like creature, and it gains temporary hit points equal to twice your warlock level plus your spellcasting ability modifier. Roll initiative for the specter, which has its own turns. The specter remains in your service until the end of your next long rest, at which point it vanishes to the afterlife.

It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you), and it gains a special bonus to its AC and saving throws, as well as to its attack and damage rolls. This bonus is equal to your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum of +0).
Once you bind a specter with this feature, you can't use the feature again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Master of Hexes
entries: Starting at 14th level, your curse becomes more persistent and grants you further benefits.
You can now curse other creatures with your Hexblade's Curse while the curse is in effect. If you do, the curse ends on the previous creature,and the curse's remaining duration carries over.
Additionally, you gain the following benefits against creatures afflicted by your Hexblade's Curse:

items: Once per turn when you deal damage to the cursed target, you can inflict {@damage 3d10} extra damage of the same type.
Any attack roll you make against the cursed target is a critical hit on a roll of19 or 20 on the d20.
If the cursed target dies, you regain hit points equal to your warlock level + your spellcasting ability modifier.

subclassFeature.name: The Ancient Phoenix
entries: Your patron is a {@creature phoenix|MTF} which has survived thousands of years of pursuit. This being has settled on the elemental plane of fire, and is so suffused with magical energy that its powerful magic can be siphoned through rituals, even on the innermost planes.

subclassFeature.name: Positive Energy Infusion
entries: Would-be Warlocks who make contact with an ancient phoenix are accidentally exposed to the raw life energy infused into a phoenix's essence. This change to the composition of your soul causes minor incompatibilities with its vessel. You may roll or choose from the following quirks to add manifestations of this change to your character.

entries.caption: Ancient Phoenix Quirks
rows: You absentmindedly ignite small fires that quickly sputter out.
You admire fire, even if it burns your friends.
You are covered in burns that mark the first time your power manifested.
You have a nervous compulsion to keep a bright light in even the barest shadow.
You have an overwhelming hatred of undead creatures.
You fidget and are irritable when you can't see the sun.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

entries.caption: Ancient Phoenix Expanded Spells
rows: {@spell beacon of hope}, {@spell melf's minute meteors}

subclassFeature.name: Mantle of Flame
entries: Starting when you choose this patron at 1st level, you can unleash the phoenix fire that blazes within you.

As an action, you wreathe yourself in swirling flame and your eyes glow like hot coals. You gain the benefits below until you use your bonus action to end the effect or you are {@condition incapacitated}:

items: Each time a creature hits you with a melee attack or touches you,it take fire damage equal to 1 plus half your warlock level.
You shed bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Warding Cyclone
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can invoke a protective, fiery gale around yourself. When you are attacked or you must make a saving throw against an effect that only deals damage, you can use your reaction to move 5 feet without provoking opportunity attacks. If your new location is outside of the range or reach of the attack or effect, the attack roll has disadvantage, or you have advantage on your save.

foundrySystem.activation.condition: you are attacked or you must make a saving throw against an effect that only deals damage

subclassFeature.name: Spark of Rebirth
entries: Starting at 10th level, in the face of defeat, your flame knits your wounds and surges outward in a fiery roar.

If you are reduced to 0 hit points, you can draw upon the phoenix's spark. You are instead restored to half of your maximum hit points, and creatures within 10 feet of you take fire damage equal to your warlock level + your spellcasting ability modifier.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Phoenix Pinion
entries: Starting at 14th level, you can manifest one of your patron's feathers to sear your foes, heal your allies, and even restore life.
As an action, you conjure a phoenix pinion in a free hand. This pinion can be used once before crumbling to ashes, and you can use it in one of the following ways:

items: For you, it is a simple melee weapon with the finesse and thrown (range 20/60) properties that deals {@damage 10d8} fire damage. When you hit with it, creatures you choose in a 20-foot radius around the target regain {@dice 5d8} hit points, and the pinion crumbles to ash.

As an action, you stab the heart of a dead creature with the pinion. If creature has died within the last 10 days, the pinion glows brilliantly for 1 minute. If the pinion isn't removed within that time, the creature's body and the pinion crumble to ash, the creature is restored to life as if by the {@spell resurrection} spell, and you can't use this option again for 7 days.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest. If you have a pinion at that time, it disintegrates.

subclassFeature.name: The Chosen of Mystra
entries: Your patron is one of the Chosen of Mystra: mortals of great power who serve Mystra, the mother of all magic. These mortals have been granted a portion of Mystra's divine essence - called spellfire - which they use to guard the Weave from disruption, preserving the status quo of magic among the realms. These chosen mortals, while extremely powerful, are not infallible themselves; they sometimes contract Warlocks to assist with their goals, granting them a small part of their silver flame in exchange.

subclassFeature.name: Protect the Weave
entries: Occasionally, warlocks of a Chosen of Mystra will receive missives from their patron, ordering them to investigate an event that might cause damage to the Weave. Such events might range from a ritual all the way to an act of the divine. Often, these events will be orchestrated purposely by an evil entity; however, it is still somewhat likely that a Wizard haphazardly creates a broken summoning circle. Work with your DM to determine such scenarios and explore them with your party.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

entries.caption: Chosen of MYstra Expanded Spells
rows: {@spell conjure minor elementals}, {@spell otiluke's resilient sphere|PHB|resilient sphere}

subclassFeature.name: Minor Spellfire
entries: When you choose this patron at 1st level, you possess a fragment of Mystra's spellfire, a flame that protects you from compulsory effects.
At the start of each of your turns, or as an action, you can end one effect for yourself that is causing you to be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.
You can use this feature twice, and expended uses are replenished when you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Chosen's Absorption
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can foil spells directed at you and steal the excess magical power shed by foiled spells for yourself.

When a spell targets only you, you can cast {@spell counterspell} without expending a spell slot. You can add half your warlock level to the ability check you make for {@spell counterspell} when you cast it in this way.

Also, when a spell fails within 60 feet of you, you can take a bonus action during your next turn to steal the spell for yourself. The spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots. You can cast the spell once as a warlock spell,using a warlock spell slot.
Once you use this bonus action, you must finish a long rest before you can do so again. A stolen spell is lost when you finish a long rest.

foundrySystem.activation.condition: in the previous turn, a spell failed within 60 feet of you

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Senses
entries: Starting at 10th level, you can project your vision and sense arcane energy.

You can cast {@spell clairvoyance} without expending a spell slot. When cast via this feature, the spell's casting time is 1 action, and your vision through the sensor gains the effects of the {@spell detect magic} spell.

subclassFeature.name: Silver Fire
entries: Starting at 14th level, you gain the ability to project your spellfire outward, blasting your enemies.

As an action, you can create a line of silver arcane energy that resembles a spout of fire. Creatures in a line 90 feet long and 5 feet wide originating from you must make a Dexterity saving throw against your warlock spell save DC, taking {@damage 8d8} force damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success. This damage bypasses resistance and immunity.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Warlock
entries: With a pseudodragon curled on his shoulder, a young elf in golden robes smiles warmly, weaving a magical charm into his honeyed words and bending the palace sentinel to his will.

As flames spring to life in her hands, a wizened human whispers the secret name of her demonic patron. infusing her spell with fiendish magic. Shifting his gaze between a battered tome and the odd alignment of the stars overhead, a wild-eyed tiefling chants the mystic ritual that will open a doorway to a distant world.

Warlocks are seekers of the knowledge that lies hidden in the fabric of the multiverse. Through pacts made with mysterious beings of supernatural power, warlocks unlock magical effects both subtle and spectacular.Drawing on the ancient knowledge of beings such as fey nobles,fiends,hags, and alien entities of the Far Realm, warlocks piece together arcane secrets to bolster their own power.

entries.name: Sworn and Beholden
entries: A warlock is defined by a pact with an otherworldly being. Sometimes the relationship between warlock and patron is like that of a cleric and a deity,though the beings that serve as patrons for warlocks are not gods.A warlock might lead a cult dedicated to a demon prince, an archdevil, or an utterly alien entity—beings not typically served by clerics. More often, though, the arrangement is similar to that between a master and an apprentice. The warlock learns and grows in power, at the cost of occasional services performed on the patron's behalf.

The magic bestowed on a warlock ranges from minor but lasting alterations to the warlock's being (such as the ability to see in darkness or to read any language) to access to powerful spells. Unlike bookish wizards, warlocks supplement their magic with some facility at hand-to-hand combat. They are comfortable in light armor and know how to use simple weapons.

entries.name: Delvers into Secrets
entries: Warlocks are driven by an insatiable need for knowledge and power,which compels them into their pacts and shapes their lives. This thirst drives warlocks into their pacts and shapes their later careers as well.

Stories of warlocks binding themselves to fiends are widely known. But many warlocks serve patrons that are not fiendish. Sometimes a traveler in the wilds comes to a strangely beautiful tower, meets its fey lord or lady, and stumbles into a pact without being fully aware of it.And sometimes,while poring over tomes of forbidden lore, a brilliant but crazed student's mind is opened to realities beyond the material world and to the alien beings that dwell in the outer void.

Once a pact is made, a warlock's thirst for knowledge and power can't be slaked with mere study and research.No one makes a pact with such a mighty patron if he or she doesn't intend to use the power thus gained. Rather, the majority of warlocks spend their days in active pursuit of their goals, which typically means some kind of adventuring. Further, the demands of their patrons drive warlocks toward adventure.

entries.name: Creating a Warlock
entries: As you make your warlock character,think about your patron and the obligations that your pact imposes upon you. What led you to make the pact, and how did you make contact with your patron? Were you seduced into summoning a devil, or did you seek out the ritual that would allow you to make contact with an alien elder god? Did you search for your patron, or did your patron find and choose you? Do you chafe under the obligations of your pact or serve joyfully in anticipation of the rewards promised to you?

Work with your DM to determine how big a part your pact will play in your character's adventuring career. Your patron's demands might drive you into adventures, or they might consist entirely of small favors you can do between adventures.

What kind of relationship do you have with your patron? Is it friendly, antagonistic, uneasy, or romantic? How important are you to your patron? What is your part in your patron's plans? Do you know other servants of your patron?

How does your patron communicate with you? If you have a familiar,it might occasionally speak with your patron's voice.Some warlocks find messages from their patrons etched on trees, mingled among tea leaves, or adrift in the clouds —messages that only the warlock can see. Other warlocks converse with their patrons in dreams or waking visions,or deal only with liaisons.

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make a warlock quickly by following these suggestions. First, Charisma should be your highest ability score, followed by Constitution. Second, choose the {@background charlatan} background. Third, choose the {@spell chill touch} and {@spell minor illusion} cantrips, along with the 1st-level spells {@spell ray of sickness} and {@spell witch bolt}.
